RT @mikedebonis: >@RepMickMulvaney at Rules hearing seeking floor amendment to CR imposing 1-yr Planned Parenthood funding moratorium
(5/5) I can say this on fairly good authority, b'c I just spoke w' Trey about this. I hope that puts any speculation to rest...
(4/5) He is here, at the very least, until it is finished...
(3/5) I have said before and I will say again: he would never leave in the middle of the Benghazi investigation.
(2/5) : Sometimes the rumor mill can really get out of hand: Trey Gowdy is NOT retiring from Congress.
(1/5) Since I've been asked about this on multiple occasions today, I thought I would provide some clarity...
It makes complete sense to me that @TGowdySC has decided to stay and continue his work on #Benghazi
He isn’t the kind of guy to leave a case midstream.
While I think he would have been a great majority leader, I absolutely respect this decision.
He wants to focus on his work on the Benghazi commission.
After talking w' @TGowdySC for 20 mins, he made it clear that he is OUT of any consideration for any leadership position.

I hope you’ll join me in keeping the victims, their families, and the Emanuel A.M.E. Church in your thoughts and prayers.
My prayers are with his family as well as with the families of those who were lost.
It's also touched me personally, as I sat next to Senator Clementa Pinckney for two years in Columbia.  He was a kind and gentle man.
The shooting in Charleston that took the lives of nine people has shaken that community and the state as a whole.
It’s truly a sad day in South Carolina.
